nodes.label: Accusations leveled against Agrappina
nodes.notes: A group of people leveled accusations against Agrappina, trying to turn Nero against her and bring her down.

nodes.label: Acte
nodes.notes: Freedwoman that Nero had an affair with.

nodes.label: Aedui
nodes.notes: One of the prominent Gallic Tribes

nodes.label: Aemilius Mamercus
nodes.notes: One of two Quaestors elected sixty-three years after founding of the Republic

nodes.label: Afranius Burrus
nodes.notes: Advised Nero during his youth on military and moral matters. Disagreed with Agrippina on the succession of Claudius.

nodes.label: Agrippina
nodes.notes: Nero’s mother and Claudius’ last wife

nodes.label: Annaeus Seneca
nodes.notes: Adviser to Nero in his youth with his oratorical and cordiality skills

nodes.label: Byzantium
nodes.notes: City founded by Greeks with fertile soil and prosperous seas

nodes.label: Cincian Law
nodes.notes: Forbade the acceptance of money or a gift for pleading a case

nodes.label: Cleopatra
nodes.notes: Was with Claudius when Calpurnia notified of the marriage between Messalina and Silius

nodes.label: Crepereius Gallus
nodes.notes: Male slave to Agrippina; killed during Nero’s assassination attempt.

nodes.label: Domitius Corbulo
nodes.notes: Responsible for the military campaign in Armenia.

nodes.label: Egyptian Equestrians
nodes.notes: Claudius surrendered the legal system to them

nodes.label: Euodus
nodes.notes: In charge of overseeing Messalina’s death.

nodes.label: Gaius Silius
nodes.notes: best-looking of rome’s young men, Messalina liked him. Having affair with Messalina.

nodes.label: Garden of Lucullus
nodes.notes: Where Messalina goes to hide from her executors.

nodes.label: Gnaeus Nonius
nodes.notes: Knight; possibly tried to assassinate the Emperor

nodes.label: Halotus
nodes.notes: Taster for imperial dinners. But is aware of the intended poisoning of Cladius.

nodes.label: Junia Silana
nodes.notes: Girlfriend of Agrippina. Noblewoman of Rome. Formerly married to Gaius Silius.

nodes.label: Junius Silanus
nodes.notes: Proconsul of Asia. Killed by Agrippina. Was preferred over Nero.

nodes.label: King Vologaeses
nodes.notes: He chose peace over war, supported Rome by supplying them hostages, and put the leading members of the Arsacid house in the Roman’s hands. King of Parthia.

nodes.label: Lepida
nodes.notes: Wife of Claudius, daughter of Antonia, and rival to Agrippina

nodes.label: Locusta
nodes.notes: Made the poison that killed Claudius

nodes.label: Lollia Paulina
nodes.notes: Wife candidate for Claudius after the murder of Messalina. She had no children so she was the most ideal candidate.

nodes.label: Lucius Silanus
nodes.notes: Brother of Junius Silanus. A praetor.

nodes.label: Messalina
nodes.notes: in the midst of adulterous affair. Third wife of Claudius.

nodes.label: Mnester
nodes.notes: Actor that Messalina had affections for.

nodes.label: Nero
nodes.notes: Senators support Nero’s effort to disallow the pleading of a case for payment or gifts & that Quaestors-designate would not be obliged to give gladatorial shows

nodes.label: New Patrician Families
nodes.notes: Claudius admitted more affluent families into the ranks of the Patricians

nodes.label: Octavia
nodes.notes: Daughter of Claudius, married Nero in the consulship of Decimus Junius and Quintus Haterus. Also sister to Britannicus and step-sister to Nero.

nodes.label: Ostia
nodes.notes: Cladius was on a prolonged stay in…

nodes.label: Pallas
nodes.notes: Nero revoked the responsibilities given to Pallas by Claudius.

nodes.label: People of Cos
nodes.notes: Group for which Claudius advocated tax exemption.

nodes.label: Poison
nodes.notes: Used as a weapon to kill many

nodes.label: Political Murder
nodes.notes: Ways that a political actor may usurp power.

nodes.label: Pomerium
nodes.notes: Expanded under the rule of Claudius

nodes.label: Quaestor
nodes.notes: Elected position, who’s function is to supervise military finance

nodes.label: Secular Games
nodes.notes: First put on by Augustus, now Claudius.

nodes.label: Sinuessa
nodes.notes: Narcissus went there when he fell ill to stress.

nodes.label: Statilius Taurus
nodes.notes: “Destroyed” by Agrippina because she coveted his gardens, accused by Tarquitius Priscus, wealthy, proconsul in Africa.

nodes.label: Suicide
nodes.notes: We feel this speaks for itself

nodes.label: Tarquitius Priscus
nodes.notes: Accuser and legate of Statilius Taurus

nodes.label: The Gallic Tribes
nodes.notes: A Celtic Group of Peoples who lived in Gaul (modern-day France)

nodes.label: The Greek People
nodes.notes: They were people and they were Greek

nodes.label: The Roman Officers
nodes.notes: Their favor caused friction between generals. Left to decide which General they supported more.

nodes.label: The Roman People
nodes.notes: The population of Rome (shocking, I know)

nodes.label: The Senate
nodes.notes: Advising body. AD 53: Received an appeal from the people of Byzantium to releive their heavy tax burden.

nodes.label: Titius Proculus
nodes.notes: Guardian for Messalina appointed by Silius. Claudius eventually ordered him to be executed.

nodes.label: Ubii
nodes.notes: The main town of a tribe where Agrippina was born, and Agrippa had taken the area under roman protection

nodes.label: Valerius Potitus
nodes.notes: One of two Quaestors first elected
